title: "Workflow Setup Instructions"
subtitle: "AI Agent-Assisted Analysis with GitHub Copilot and Claude"
---


Goals:

-  Setup software environment for AI agent-assisted analysis in Stata and R
-  Enable GitHub Copilot and Claude AI integration
-  Be able to reproduce AI-assisted coding workflow demonstrated in the seminar


## Software setup

### Step 1. Prerequisites software: Stata, R, Python

1. Go to the World Bnk Software Center App and install of the following software (if not already installed):

-  Stata 19 or higher (latest version available)
-  R (latest version: 4.5.2)
-  Python (latest version: 3.13+)
-  Quarto (latest version: 1.3.343)
    - May require a software installation request on eservice

-  Git (latest version: 2.52+)
-  (Optional) Github Desktop

### Step 2. Install important python package

1. Open Command Prompt (cmd) or PowerShell:
   - Press `Win + R`, type `cmd` or `powershell`, and hit Enter.

2. Type `pip install uv` and press Enter to install the `uv` package.

   - `uv` is a package that allows environments management in python, see [https://pypi.org/project/uv/](https://pypi.org/project/uv/){target="_blank"}

3. Check if UV is installed correctly by typing `uv --version` in the Command Prompt or PowerShell. You should see the version number of UV displayed. Someting like this:

   ```
   uv 0.9.18 (0cee76417 2025-12-16)
   ```

### Step 3. Install Positron (IDE) [^1]

1. Download Positron from [https://positron.posit.co/download.html](https://positron.posit.co/download.html){target="_blank"}

NOTE: Use "Windows 10, 11 x64 (system level install)", not the "user level install"

2. Make a "Software Installation Request" on eservice.

  - Go to [eservices/](http://eservices/){target="_blank"}

  - Select "[Software Installation Request](https://worldbankgroup.service-now.com/wbg/en/software-installation-request?id=wbg_sc_catalog&sys_id=bd1e71b86f16d340db112d232e3ee4b7&table=sc_cat_item&searchTerm=Software%20installation){target="_blank"}"

  - See [KB0076748](https://worldbankgroup.service-now.com/wbg?id=wbg_knowledge_article&sys_id=50a6a237971b6a500b41bf07f053af30&table=kb_knowledge&searchTerm=Software%20installation){target="_blank"} for more details.

3. Once approved, you will have two paths to install Positron:

   - ITS Pesonnel will connect to your machine remotely and will install Positron for you using admin password.

   - You will need to use admin password to install Positron yourself.

   In either way, follow these installation instructions:

   - Step 1: Copy the executable (exe) or installation folder to C:\WBG.

   - Step 2: Launch the command shell (cmd.exe) as an administrator.

   - Step 3: Navigate to C:\WBG in the command shell.

   - Step 4: Set the user profile, TEMP, and TMP environments, and Launch the executable from the shell prompt by typing:

     ```{pws}
     set userprofile=c:\wbg\temp
     set temp=c:\wbg\temp\temp
     set tmp=c:\wbg\temp\temp
     Positron-20XX.XX.X-XXX-Setup-x64.exe
     ```
     Note: Replace `Positron-20XX.XX.X-XXX-Setup-x64.exe` with the actual filename of the Positron installer you downloaded.

[^1]: Alternatively, you can use Visual Studio Code (VS Code) as your IDE. Overall, we encourage using Positron because of its better context awareness when developing R/Stata and other analysis scripts. If you opt using VS Code, it could be installed form the software center. Please note that some steps below may differ slightly when using VS Code instead of Positron. In addition, VS code doe snot have many built-in features for R language that Positron has out-of-the-box as well as laks key binding relevant to data science tasks.

## Step 4. Install Extensions in Positron

Extensions are add-ons that enhance the functionality of Positron. To install  extensions open the Extensions panel by clicking on the square icon on the left sidebar or pressing `Ctrl+Shift+X`.




## Prerequisites

Before starting, ensure you have:

- World Bank laptop
- Administrative rights to install software (or contact IT support)
- A GitHub account linked to [github.com/worldbank](https://github.com/worldbank){target="_blank"}







## Step 1: Install Positron or VS Code

### Option A: Positron (Recommended for R and Python Users)

1. Download Positron from [https://github.com/posit-dev/positron/releases](https://github.com/posit-dev/positron/releases){target="_blank"}
2. Install the application following the standard installation process
3. Launch Positron

### Option B: Visual Studio Code

1. Download VS Code from [https://code.visualstudio.com/](https://code.visualstudio.com/){target="_blank"}
2. Install the application
3. Launch VS Code

## Step 2: Set Up GitHub and GitHub Copilot

### 2.1 Configure GitHub Account

1. Ensure your GitHub account is added to the World Bank organization at [https://github.com/worldbank](https://github.com/worldbank){target="_blank"}
2. Sign in to GitHub in Positron/VS Code:
   - Open Command Palette (Ctrl+Shift+P / Cmd+Shift+P)
   - Type "GitHub: Sign In"
   - Follow the authentication process

### 2.2 Enable GitHub Copilot

1. Request GitHub Copilot access through your organization administrator
2. Once approved, install the GitHub Copilot extension:
   - Open Extensions panel (Ctrl+Shift+X / Cmd+Shift+X)
   - Search for "GitHub Copilot"
   - Click "Install"
3. Sign in to GitHub Copilot when prompted

## Step 3: Configure Claude AI Access

### 3.1 Install Required Extensions

For Positron/VS Code with Claude integration:

1. Install the "Claude Dev" or similar AI assistant extension
2. Configure API access:
   - Obtain API key (consult with your team lead or IT)
   - Open Settings (Ctrl+, / Cmd+,)
   - Search for Claude/AI settings
   - Enter your API credentials

### 3.2 Set Up Model Communication Protocol (MCP)

1. Configure MCP settings for context awareness:
   - Enable workspace indexing
   - Set up project-specific context files
   - Configure data access permissions

## Step 4: Install Language-Specific Tools

### For Stata Users

1. Install Stata (if not already installed)
2. Install Stata extension for VS Code/Positron:
   - Search for "Stata" in Extensions
   - Install "Stata Enhanced" or similar
3. Configure Stata executable path in settings

### For R Users

1. Install R from [https://cran.r-project.org/](https://cran.r-project.org/){target="_blank"}
2. R support is built into Positron
3. For VS Code, install R extension:
   - Search for "R" in Extensions
   - Install R extension

### For Python Users

1. Install Python from [https://www.python.org/](https://www.python.org/){target="_blank"}
2. Install Python extension:
   - Search for "Python" in Extensions
   - Install official Python extension by Microsoft

## Step 5: Verify Installation

### Test GitHub Copilot

1. Create a new file (e.g., `test.R` or `test.do`)
2. Start typing a comment describing a function
3. Copilot should suggest code completions

### Test Claude Integration

1. Open Command Palette
2. Look for Claude/AI assistant commands
3. Test with a simple prompt

## Step 6: Configure Your Workspace

### Set Up Project Structure

```
my-project/
├── data/
│   ├── raw/
│   └── processed/
├── scripts/
├── output/
└── README.md
```

### Create .gitignore

Add the following to your `.gitignore`:

```
# Data files
data/raw/*
data/processed/*

# Output files
output/*

# Temporary files
*.tmp
.Rhistory
.RData
```

## Troubleshooting

### GitHub Copilot Not Working

- Verify your subscription is active
- Check internet connection
- Sign out and sign back in
- Restart Positron/VS Code

### Claude API Connection Issues

- Verify API key is correct
- Check firewall settings
- Ensure VPN is connected if required

### Language Extensions Not Loading

- Verify language runtime is installed
- Check extension compatibility
- Review extension logs for errors
